selected_quotes: Interesting. The list of non ergogenic reasons to consume creatine might have just gotten one longer
#Longevity Coaching Tip O’ the Day- Creative supplementation may help burn fat

citation.abstract: The current obesity epidemic has focused a great deal of attention on cellular pathways of energy expenditure. While a crucial part of this process is diet-induced thermogenesis, the underlying mechanisms have remained unexplained. In this issue of Cell Metabolism, Kazak et al. (2017) describe a new thermogenic pathway in adipocytes that responds to diet overload, involving creatine cycling. These data suggest that this pathway might limit weight gain during overnutrition.
citation.title: Creatine Fuels the Thermic Effect of Feeding

news.title: Repurposed Asthma Drug Shows Blood Sugar Improvement among Some Diabetics
news.summary: After 12 weeks of taking an anti-asthma drug, a subset of patients with type 2 diabetes showed a clinically significant reduction in blood glucose during a randomized, double blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial, report University of California…

news.title: Could a 30-year-old asthma drug lead to a new treatment for diabetes?
news.summary: The anti-inflammatory drug amlexanox was invented in Japan in the 1980s to treat asthma but was quickly eclipsed by more effective treatments.

news.title: Anti-inflammatory medication could help treat type 2 diabetes, study finds
news.summary: SAN DIEGO (KUSI) — An anti-inflammatory medication used for a variety of conditions could also be effective in treating type 2 diabetes, scientists with UC San Diego and the University of Michigan reported Wednesday.

news.title: Asthma drug shows promise in treating obesity and diabetes - Healthcanal.com
